result.execSummary:
The defendant Nellie Rose Blackdeer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Probation in this case is consecutive to the jail sentence in case 15CF3, Ct 2 and Ct 5 in this case are concurrent to each other as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes: Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent  Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions..  Bond of $100.00 applied.

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request
Defendant is to participate in the Ho-Chunk Family Court Wellness Program as soon as available and comply with all requirements and obligations that they establish for you.  All treatment records shall be made available to the agent. If recommended by the program the defendant is to take the drug Vivitrol as prescribed.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.
Defendant is not to possess any illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Additionally, defendant may possess prescription drugs only when prescribed by a medical professional for the defendant, which shall be taken as prescribed.    
The defendant shall have no contact with Ryen Knuth  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  There will be an exception that there may be third party contact no more than three times a week for child placement/visitation.   If Ryen Knuth contacts the defendant in any way, she is to report this to her agent and to law enforcement within 6 hours of the contact, if on a weekend then she is to report six hours into the first business day.  
Defendant is not to associate with anyone using or possessing illegal drugs or involved in illegal drug activities/
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.
The defendant is to remain employed or in school or a combination of both.  If unemployed comminity service of 10 hours a week needs to be done.  See Community Service.

timeConds.notes: Community Service will only come into play if the defendant is unemployed,  then she is to do 10 hours per week, this should apply for the first year.  There will also be an exception for during that time period if she is enrolled in any type of full-time treatment program where it is not then possible to do the community service.  The defendant must find her own community service and must be approved by the agent.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant was granted 179 days credit for time served.
Concurrent with: Prison Sentence on Ct 5 in this same case

superMiscConds.notes: Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a licensed Wisconsin medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not own, use or possess any drug paraphernalia.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Extended Supervision on Ct 5 in this same case as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.
Concurrent with: Prison sentence on Ct 2 in this same case
Concurrent with: Extended Supervision on Ct 2 in this same case
